result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.
Judge approved Preliminary Hearing to be scheduled - No warrant to be issued.

3:07 PM Defendant Gunnar T.B. Ward not in court.  Attorney Robert M. Osborne appeared by video for Gunnar T.B. Ward.  Attorney Crystal Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Osborne asking to be set for trial.  State objects there hasn't been a preliminary hearing, requests a warrant be authorized.  Warrant authorized withheld until 9/2 @ Noon for defendant to appear.

Case Tracking was requested-denied; There must be a global resolution on all cases to allow for case tracking. Once a resolution is reached the cases are heard by Judge with the oldest case.  Defendant's other cases are currently set for Jury Trial in April of 2023.

Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:20 PM Defendant Gunnar T.B. Ward appeared by video, in custody from Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Robert M. Osborne appeared by video for Gunnar T.B. Ward.  Attorney Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Osborne makes bond argument asking to reduce bond to $500.00 cash. State objects to lower cash bond. Court modifies bond to $1000.00 cash with prior conditions.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Victim 1

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.
